sik.server
Class RMIServerImpl

java.lang.Object
  java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
          java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
              sik.server.RMIServerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, sik.common.RMIServer
public class RMIServerImpl
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements sik.common.RMIServer, java.io.Serializable

The RMI server implementation which contains method implementations of an RMI server interface. The methods provide RMI connectivity and and data object transfer

Author:
Jamie Brindle (06352322) - Manchester Metropolitan University
See Also:

RMIServerImpl

              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Class constructor

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - when any connectivity problems occur
Method Detail

startRMIServer

public void startRMIServer()
Starts the RMI server running, creating new instances of using objects, defines a security manager, a security policy and the RMI server code base and binds the RMI server to the registry and name space to allow it's methods to be invoked remotely

dispatchMessage

public void dispatchMessage(java.lang.String theMessage)
Used to return a supplied message to the server logger, which displays and records any specified message from this RMI server or an RMI client

Specified by:
dispatchMessage in interface sik.common.RMIServer
Parameters:
theMessage - The message to be displayed

getStudentRecord

public sik.common.StudentRecord getStudentRecord(java.lang.String uniqueInput,
                                                 java.lang.String computerName,
                                                 boolean isRFIDInput)
                                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Used to return a student record object

Specified by:
getStudentRecord in interface sik.common.RMIServer
Parameters:
uniqueInput - Defined a unique identifier of a student record which will either be an RFID tag serial number or a student ID number
computerName - The computer host name of the machine which invoked this method
isRFIDInput - Defines whether the uniqueInput is of type RFID serial or student ID number and which corresponding operation to perform
Returns:
studentRecord The student record object in which to return
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - When some remote connectivity problems occur

saveStore

public void saveStore(sik.common.Store store,
                      java.lang.String computerName)
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Saves a supplied student records store to a local file

Specified by:
saveStore in interface sik.common.RMIServer
Parameters:
store - The store object to save
computerName - The name of the computer that invoked this message
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - When any remote connectivity problems occur

getStore

public sik.common.Store getStore(java.lang.String computerName)
Returns a student records store, while recording the details of the computer host which invoked this methods

Specified by:
getStore in interface sik.common.RMIServer
Parameters:
computerName - The name of the computer which invoked this method
Returns:
store The student records store object to return

getStore_silent

public sik.common.Store getStore_silent()
Returns a student records store. It's similar to the getStore() method however it does not record any details of the remote method invoker

Specified by:
getStore_silent in interface sik.common.RMIServer
Returns:
store The student records store object in which to return
See Also:
getStore(String)

getRegistryDetails

private java.lang.String getRegistryDetails()
Returns a string containing information about the current server binding, registry state the URL in which binding has been attempted and whether or not a binding has been successful or not and also containing the reasons for a server binding failure. This is generally used for debugging purposes

Returns:
registryDetails The string containing information of which to return
